column1: quotes  the  following  dicta  expressed  in  Executive  Engineer  v.  Lokesh

column2: It is a well-settled principle that if an act is required to be performed

column1: by  a  private  person  within  a  specified

column2: primarily be mandatory, but when a public functionary  is required
to  perform  a  public  function  within  a  timeframe,  the  same  will  be
held to be directory unless the consequences therefore are specific.
